dublin_core.dcvalue: Changing technology is creating new ways to approach nursing education and practice Beginning in 2003 using a quasi experimental design this project introduced personal digital assistants PDAs as a clinical tool to five experimental and control groups of students and faculty The handheld device or PDA was loaded with e books for clinical practice Differences in learning styles and preferences emerged during the different phases of the study Students were quickly able to master the technology and use the device effectively reporting that they liked the concise nature of the information obtained No students expressed dissatisfaction or regret at being in the experimental group Results and implications for clinical practice education and library resources are discussed
Textbooks on tap: using electronic books housed in handheld devices in nursing clinical courses.
